title: US Treasury sanctions Bosnian Serb leaders for ‘inflammatory legislation’
description: The law would allow Republika Srpska, part of Bosnia and Herzegovina, to ignore the country's Constitutional Court.

title: Senegal dissolves party of opposition leader Sonko
description: Ousmane Sonko faces charges of fomenting insurrection as interior ministry says his PASTEF party has been dissolved.

title: England win dramatic fifth Test to draw Ashes series
description: Retiring England bowler Stuart Broad took the last two Australian wickets to help England win the final Test.

title: X reorganizes trust and safety team under Musk and CEO Yaccarino
description: The team, responsible for content moderation, has been a focus of criticism since Musk's takeover.

title: Photos: US researchers, conservationists clash over horseshoe crabs
description: Blue blood from the crabs is used in medicine, but their eggs are a critical food source for threatened bird subspecies.

title: What is a supermoon?
description: There are usually three to four supermoons in a year; Al Jazeera explains the phenomenon.

title: What’s behind the fighting in Ein el-Hilweh Palestinian refugee camp?
description: At least nine people killed and dozens wounded in clashes at the camp, where 63,000 people live in crowded conditions.

title: Are French efforts to reset ties with Africa failing?
description: France's influence in West Africa is weakening despite President Emmanuel Macron's efforts.

title: Musk threatens to sue researchers who documented the rise in hate tweets
description: X says research seems intended 'to harm Twitter’s business by driving advertisers away' with 'incendiary claims'.

title: US to introduce UN resolution for multinational force in Haiti
description: State Department says US will provide resources to the force after Kenya expresses willingness to lead Haiti mission.

title: Indian guard kills colleague and three passengers on train, then hails Modi
description: A railway security constable shoots dead a senior colleague on a train travelling from Mumbai to Jaipur.

title: Outrage after Bahrain delivery rider suspended for eating cancelled order
description: The punishment of the Talabat rider sparks anger among social media users in the Arab world.

title: Pee-wee Herman actor Paul Reubens dies aged 70
description: US actor whose film, Pee-wee's Big Adventure, was cult classic died after battle with cancer, his publicist says.

title: White House recommends the FBI limit its usage of spy database
description: Officials advise limiting Section 702 searches to national security threats, amid bipartisan scrutiny of the database.

title: Rain to bring brief respite to Phoenix after record heatwave scalds US city
description: Arizona's capital is grappling with sky-high temperatures, as neighbouring California contends with wildfires.

title: Photos: Extreme rain in Beijing after typhoon turns roads into rivers
description: At least two people were killed as floods swept through Beijing after Typhoon Doksuri dumped heavy rainfall on the city.

title: Gims cancels Tunisia performance to protest against treatment of refugees
description: The Congolese-French rapper has cancelled his appearance in Tunisia after hundreds of people were 'expelled to Libya'.

title: Deadly clashes between Palestinian groups in Lebanon camp for third day
description: At least nine people killed and dozens wounded as efforts to broker ceasefire at Ein el-Hilweh camp fail.

title: Lebanon’s new central bank head says reforms planned to deal with economy
description: Wassim Mansouri is to take over as interim chief of Lebanon's central bank after Riad Salameh steps down.

title: Senegal restricts internet as opposition leader formally charged
description: Internet services are being suspended as Ousmane Sonko is formally charged with fomenting insurrection.

title: ‘Word of God’: Why Muslims are opposed to the burning of the Quran
description: The Quran is Islam's holy book, the primary source of guidance and law for Muslims across the world.

title: West African central bank cancels Niger $51m bond issuance due to sanctions
description: The cancellation is due to sanctions imposed on Sunday by the West African ECOWAS bloc after last week's coup in Niger.

title: Road to normalising ties with Saudi Arabia ‘still long’: Israeli official
description: Members of Israel's hard-right government have ruled out concessions to Palestinians as part of any deal with Riyadh.

title: Trump holds commanding lead over GOP rivals despite legal woes: Poll
description: Former US president has 54 percent support among likely Republican primary voters, New York Times/Siena poll finds.

title: Germany suspends aid to Niger, cooperation after coup
description: Berlin makes decision after the European Union and France cut financial aid to the West African nation last week.

title: Climate displacement threatens Indigenous Guna people in Panama: HRW
description: Panama's government has failed to follow through with promised aide for Indigenous people, Human Rights Watch says.

title: China imposes drone export curbs amid US tech tensions
description: Beijing says it wants to safeguard 'national security and interests' amid escalating tension with Washington.

title: July set to become world’s hottest month on record: What happened?
description: July 2023 has broken global temperature records, raising fears about what patterns could next emerge.
